intro: Spigelia laurina var. latifolia, commonly known as broadleaf spigelia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its showy, coral-red to orange-red tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub with opposite, ovate to lanceolate leaves that are often broader than those of the typical variety. Its flowers are borne in clusters at the ends of the branches, and the plant produces follicles that contain seeds. It thrives in moist, acidic soils and is often found in woodland habitats.
